paper_abstract: This paper presents the problem of outdoor vehicle localization during unusual maneuvers with the Interacting Multiple Model (IMM) and Extended Kalman Filter (EKF) approaches. IMM, contrary to classical methods, is based on the discretization of the vehicle evolution space into simple maneuvers. Each maneuver is represented by a simple dynamic model such as a constant velocity or a constant turning model. This allows the method to be optimized for highly dynamic vehicles. In this work, we focus on unusual vehicle maneuvers during some special driving situations, including very strong accelerations, high speed turnings or backwards driving with stop stages. The presented results are based on real measurements collected from different scenarios. Based on an EKF vs. IMM comparison, these results show a real interest of using the IMM method in order to take into account unusual maneuvers. (C) 2010 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Low cost IMU-Odometer-GPS ego localization for unusual maneuvers
